product_name: NeutrogenaHydro Boost Hyaluronic Acid Moisturizer SPF 50
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackHSA/FSA eligibleQuench dry skin while protecting against sun exposure. Neutrogena'a Hydro Boost Hyaluronic Acid Moisturizer SPF 50 is a hydrating & fragrance-free daily facial moisturizer with broad spectrum SPF 50 sunscreen and contains hyaluronic acid, glycerin & antioxidants.
details: DetailsBenefitsNeutrogena Hydro Boost Weightless Daily Facial Moisturizer with hyaluronic acid and SPF 50Gel face moisturizer quenches & soothes dryness while boosting hydration for soft, smooth skinFragrance-free face moisturizer clinically proven to hydrate all day for lasting dry skin reliefInstantly hydrates for smoother skin and delivers radiant, healthy-looking skin in just one weekNon-comedogenic and hypoallergenicKey IngredientsNon-greasy moisturizer with SPF 50 Helioplex sunscreen for invisible UVA/UVB protectionFormulated with hyaluronic acid, a hydrator found naturally in skin and recognized by dermatologistsSupercharged antioxidants like vitamin E fight against environmental aggressorsFormulated WithoutFragranceDyesParabensMineral OilOxybenzoneItem 2587006How To UseFor sunscreen use: Apply generously and evenly 15 minutes before sun exposure Reapply at least every 2 hours Use a water resistant sunscreen if swimming or sweating.Sun Protection Measures: Spending time in the sun increases your risk of skin cancer and early skin aging. To decrease this risk, regularly use a sunscreen with a Broad Spectrum SPF value of 15 or higher and other sun protection measures including: Limit time in the sun, especially from 10 a.m.-2 p.m. Wear long-sleeved shirts, pants, hats, and sunglasses Children under 6 months of age: Ask a doctor.Application tips: Apply daily on your face and neck as the last step in your skincare routine. Wears beautifully under makeup.Other information: Protect this product from excessive heat and direct sun. May stain some fabrics. Protect from freezingPrecautions: For external use only. Do not use on damaged or broken skin. When using this product keep out of eyes. Rinse with water to remove. Stop use and ask a doctor if rash occurs. Keep out of reach of children. If swallowed, get medical help or contact a Poison Control Center right away.IngredientsActive: Avobenzone 3% Homosalate 15% Octisalate 5% Octocrylene 10% Purpose SunscreenInactive: Water, Butyloctyl Salicylate, Glycerin, Alcohol Denat., Silica, Caprylyl Methicone, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Aluminum Starch Octenylsuccinate, Dimethicone, Polyurethane-62, Phenoxyethanol, Pentylene Glycol, Styrene/Acrylates Copolymer, Sodium Acryloyldimethyltaurate/VP Crosspolymer, Acrylates/Dimethicone Copolymer, Glyceryl Stearate, Chlorphenesin, Menthyl Lactate, Tocopheryl Acetate, Disodium EDTA, Trideceth-6, Hydrolyzed Hyaluronic Acid, Hydroxymethoxyphenyl Decanone, Sodium Hydroxide
how_to_use: For sunscreen use: Apply generously and evenly 15 minutes before sun exposure Reapply at least every 2 hours Use a water resistant sunscreen if swimming or sweating.Sun Protection Measures: Spending time in the sun increases your risk of skin cancer and early skin aging. To decrease this risk, regularly use a sunscreen with a Broad Spectrum SPF value of 15 or higher and other sun protection measures including: Limit time in the sun, especially from 10 a.m.-2 p.m. Wear long-sleeved shirts, pants, hats, and sunglasses Children under 6 months of age: Ask a doctor.Application tips: Apply daily on your face and neck as the last step in your skincare routine. Wears beautifully under makeup.Other information: Protect this product from excessive heat and direct sun. May stain some fabrics. Protect from freezingPrecautions: For external use only. Do not use on damaged or broken skin. When using this product keep out of eyes. Rinse with water to remove. Stop use and ask a doctor if rash occurs. Keep out of reach of children. If swallowed, get medical help or contact a Poison Control Center right away.
ingredients: Active: Avobenzone 3% Homosalate 15% Octisalate 5% Octocrylene 10% Purpose SunscreenInactive: Water

reviews.headline: It is ok but too shiny for me
reviews.comments: This product is ok for a sunscreen. It feels ok when you first put it on but gets flaky towards the end of application. It is very moisturizing but extremely to shiny and greasy for me . If it wasn't for that I would repurchase it .

reviews.headline: best moisturizer and sunscreen
reviews.comments: best product for my acne-prone skin. makes my skin glowy and i think it's been healing my moisture barrier

reviews.headline: only sunscreen to break me out in a long time
reviews.comments: broke me out so badly I am still dealing with it a month later will never use again

reviews.headline: Buy this one
reviews.comments: My friend had the higher end ultra sheer Neutrogena sunscreen, and she had to use mine instead; this doesn't make you look like a ghost, and with a spf of 50 it was great for the Grand Canyon

reviews.headline: My go to for summer
reviews.comments: I use this all year especially in the summer and when we go to the southwest.

reviews.headline: Good facial moisturizer
reviews.comments: This moisturizer is good, and I like that it doesn't leave a white haze on my face. But it seems to work its way into my eyes, and it stings for a long time. I don't think I will buy it again, but it is good enough.

reviews.headline: NO PEELING!!
reviews.comments: Thats all jusy buy it!

reviews.headline: Absolutely love
reviews.comments: purchased this due to the spf rating. I use Olay sensitive during the winter months and usually add Neutrogena SPF, but I found this product this spring and decided to try it. I absolutely love. I use serum first and then this. I absorbs nicely and doesn't leave my skin sticky. I use under my eyes and my eye lids and I do not experience any burning. I occasionally use powder foundation and it holds all day. the scent is nice and not over powering like other products.

reviews.headline: BURNS
reviews.comments: Wanted to love this product however it burns my eyes!!

reviews.headline: Would buy again
reviews.comments: Great product.

reviews.headline: Worst eye stinging ever
reviews.comments: I can only put this on about half of my face because of how incredibly badly it makes my eyes sting. Even if I take care to avoid the eye area, it creeps in them somehow. Feels nice as a moisturizer but it makes me look more sweaty/oil slick than glowy. Have to completely cover my face with setting powder for my skin to not look wet.

reviews.headline: Good...but oily
reviews.comments: this product provided a good moisturizer for my skin but it left my skin oily. I used it with a hydrating serum after but I also used the moisturizer by itself and it still made my skin oily. It made my face smell like sunscreen but it helped with an initial layer of sun protection. If it wasn't so oily I would like this product.

reviews.headline: its oily and smells bad
reviews.comments: not my favorite. its oily, and it has a not pleasant sun screen smell. I wouldn't buy it again.

reviews.headline: Burning
reviews.comments: Works well on majority of the face. However, my eyebrows and any contact with the under eyes was insane. Burning, itchy, puffy, allergic reaction type symptoms. Never have reacted to any product and I have had success with neutrogena and other hydro boost products. This one is a no for me personally. Could not continue using knowing the burning allergic reaction/chemical burn feeling on my eyebrows specifically.

reviews.headline: Burns eyes
reviews.comments: This product is hydrating and does absorb into skin well if you rub it in well. It can look greasy and feel greasy because it tends to seperate in the bottle. It would be great but unfortunately it burns the heck out of my eyes, even when I try to avoid the eye area it still makes my eyes sting and water. It also taste like sunscreen. I dont put it on my eyes or lips but so how (maybe because its greasy and also bot sweat proof?) it makes its way to my eyes and lips. I will use it up but i wont buy it again.

reviews.headline: Feels amazing
reviews.comments: I used this product on my oily acne prone skin and have had no issues so far. I personally have been loving the entire skin care line and highly recommend especially for oily. I would suggest using the entire line of products together because they make for a lovely product combination that makes your face feel very clean and hydrated.

reviews.headline: Good product
reviews.comments: Helpful to moisturize and sunscreen. Contains retinol as well. I would buy again.

reviews.headline: don't buy
reviews.comments: let me just say this.. it is not good in my opinion. theres no white cast so thats a benefit. but it broke me out so bad and made my current breakouts very inflamed, and made my skin red and itchy. when i went in the sun it made my skin burn.

reviews.headline: I want to love it but I just can't.
reviews.comments: I was so excited initially because the idea of a moisturizer with spf 50 sounds amazing. But unfortunately it just doesn't work with my skin. I'm noticing tiny breakouts, it makes my skin look greasy, and I have tried to apply makeup after using and it just goes on horribly and the sunscreen will pill like crazy with or without makeup on. I you have very dry skin and don't wear makeup this may work for you, but unfortunately it doesn't work for me.

reviews.headline: I don't think there's a difference!
reviews.comments: I wish this product was better and made my skin glow, but I don't see a difference.

media.headline: Bring back the SPF 15 Oil Free Moisture
media.caption: Bring this back

faceoff_positive.comments:
I have been using this sun product for several days and this is my impression of it. 

Its texture is really light, it absorbs quickly into my skin and doesn't leave a white cast on my face. It's effect is matte, it doesn't leave my face shiny or greasy which I loved because my skin tends to be combination to oily. It contains hyaluronic acid and vitamin E so it not only protects my skin but also moisturises it. I love that it has SPF 50 because I can use it every day and my skin is really protected during the day. It says on the packaging that the formula is non-comedogenic so it shouldn't cause any acne breakouts and it doesn't contain any fragrance.

I think it's one of my favourite Neutrogena sunscreens and I will buy it again. My face feels hydrated, smooth and glowing when I apply it and it has a sunscreen factor of 50 so it's the best of both worlds, a moisturiser and a sunscreen in one product.
faceoff_positive.headline: Moisturises and protects my face.

faceoff_negative.comments:
Please Bring back the SPF 15 Oil Free Moisture Facial Moisturizer. I've tried the Hydro Boost Products: Hyaluronic SPF 50 Moisturizer, the Water Gel, Water Cream even another brand, Glossmetics, but NOTHING is as good as the old, discontinued SPF 15 Oil-Free Moisture Facial Moisturizer Lotion. Why would you discontinue a wonderful product? If sales were down, then you should have began a new aggressive Marketing Plan focusing on the tried and true product which was around for at least 30 years! If you want to market the Hydro-Boost line, at least give us the choice of using what we want. Here is why the discontinued product is better:

It gives a much better finishSmooth, soothing, and you can use a little for a dewey glow, or a little more for a beautiful, SMOOTH vibrant glossy shine. Plus, any SPF over 15 or 30 is redundant. 15 is all you need. 50 is just over-kill, and makes the Hydro-boost product feel like thick sunscreen. The discontinued product was 4 ounces compared to the measly 1.7 ounces for the Hydro-Boost products.Bring back the SPF 15 Oil Free Moisture! It wasn't broken, so why did you try to fix something that wasn't broken?
faceoff_negative.headline: Bring back the SPF 15 Oil Free Moisture

rollup.name: Hydro Boost Hyaluronic Acid Moisturizer SPF 50
